summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetState method retrieves the state of the filter graph—paused, running, or stopped.

State transitions are not necessarily synchronous. Therefore, when you call this method, the filter graph might be in transition to a new state. In that case, the method blocks until the transition completes or until the specified time-out elapses.

member.param: Duration of the time-out, in milliseconds, or INFINITE to specify an infinite time-out.
Receives a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: Returns an HRESULT value. Possible values include the following.

listheader.description: The filter graph is still in transition to the indicated state.
The filter graph is paused, but cannot cue data.

The IMediaControl interface provides methods for controlling the flow of data through the filter graph. It includes methods for running, pausing, and stopping the graph. The Filter Graph Manager implements this interface. For more information on filter graph states, see Data Flow in the Filter Graph.
